meanings.definition: To rate or appraise too highly.
meanings.sent1: Some people tend to overrate their own abilities.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to overrate a movie based on its trailer.
meanings.sent3: He always overrates his cooking skills, but his burnt toast tells a different story.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overrate her favorite restaurant, claiming it's a five-star experience every time.
meanings.sent5: The coach warned the team not to overrate their opponent, as they were known for surprises.

meanings.definition: To value or esteem too highly.
meanings.sent1: She often overrates material possessions, thinking they bring true happiness.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to overrate someone just because of their social status.
meanings.sent3: He overrates his lucky socks, believing they have magical powers on game day.
meanings.sent4: The artist overrates his own work, thinking every piece is a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reminded the students not to overrate popularity, as true friends are more valuable.
